intro: Hitoa mooreensis, commonly known as the Moore's hitoa, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
